question.title: Length of the Largest Subarray
question.content:
You are given ‘N’ distinct integers in the form of an array ‘ARR’. You need to print the length of the longest subarray in which the numbers are present in a continuous sequence.

Note: All elements are distinct from the array.

For example:
Let ‘ARR’ be: [1, 2, 4]
Then the largest subarray with continuous sequence will be: [1, 2]
So the length will be 2.
Input Format :
The first line of input contains an integer ‘T’, denoting the number of test cases.

The first line of each test case contains a single integer ‘N’, representing the size of the array.

The second line of each test case contains ‘N’ space-separated integers, representing the elements of the array ‘ARR’.
Output Format :
For each test case, print the length of the longest subarray having a continuous sequence.

Print output of each test case in a separate line.
Note :
You do not need to print anything. It has already been taken care of. Just implement the given function.
Constraints :
1 <= T <= 10
1 <= N <= 5*10^3
1 <= ARR[i] <= 10^9

Time Limit: 1 sec
Sample Input 1 :
2
3
1 3 2
3
1 4 2
Sample Output 1 :
3
1
Explanation For Sample Input 1 :
For test case 1: 
The whole array consists of continuous elements.
So the length is 3.

For test case 2: 
The largest subarray with continuous sequence will be [1] or [2] or [4].
So the length will be 1.
Sample Input 2 :
2
4 
14 12 11 20
3
10 12 11
Sample Output 2 :
2
3

rephrased.body: Given an array of 'N' distinct integers, find the length of the longest subarray where the elements form a continuous sequence (i.e., their sorted order has a difference of 1 between consecutive elements).

testcases.explanation: The whole array [1, 3, 2] consists of continuous elements (1, 2, 3 when sorted). So the length is 3.
The largest subarray with continuous sequence will be [1] or [2] or [4]. So the length will be 1.
The longest continuous sequence subarray is [12, 11] or [11, 12]. Thus, length is 2.
The whole array [10, 12, 11] consists of continuous elements (10, 11, 12 when sorted). So the length is 3.
The whole array [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] consists of continuous elements. So the length is 5.
The whole array [5,4,3,2,1] consists of continuous elements (1,2,3,4,5 when sorted). So the length is 5.
The array only contains one element. The length of the longest continuous subarray is 1.
The longest continuous sequence subarray is [10, 11, 12, 13, 14]. Thus, length is 5.
